context: The Estonian word 'taha' is the 1st person singular form of the verb 'tahta', which means to want, desire, or wish. It's commonly used in everyday speech to express personal desires or preferences. In present tense: ma tahan (I want), sa tahad (you want), ta tahab (he/she wants), me tahame (we want), te tahate (you all want), nad tahavad (they want).
